content: * *Fo Shan Ting Da Bo Gong Temple** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 佛山亭大伯公廟) is a Chinese [temple](/wiki/Temple) in Singapore located in [Pulau Ubin](/wiki/Pulau_Ubin). ## History The temple was founded in 1869. In 2010, the temple began a fundraising campaign in order to rebuild the temple. The temple holds a six-day celebration to celebrate the birthday of [Tua Pek Kong](/wiki/Tua_Pek_Kong). ## News articles - "When Gods walked on Ubin: Rebuilt temple marks birthday of resident deity". [The Straits Times](/wiki/The_Straits_Times) (online). 2019-05-27. Retrieved 2022-07-14. 1°24′11″N 103°58′04″E﻿ / ﻿1.4031°N 103.9678°E﻿ / 1.4031; 103.9678 - Tua Pek Kong Temples - Pulau Ubin Heritage Trail This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Fo Shan Ting Da Bo Gong Temple
